definition: hand/(formal) to hold/person engaged in certain types of work/person skilled in certain types of work/personal(ly)/convenient/classifier for skill/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]

sentences.english: Sometimes she sews by hand too.
I was able to look at opportunities to sew from my fingers.
sentences.chinese: 而我卻無力地看着機遇從我手縫中溜走。

sentences.english: You can sew it on a machine or hand sew.
With the sewing machine I can produce two times more work than sewing by hand.
sentences.chinese: 有這臺縫紉機，我的產出是手縫的三倍。

sentences.english: We can sew by hand or with a machine.
sentences.chinese: 我們可用手縫或機器縫。

sentences.english: Inside, the Golf has beautifully stitched upholstery and soft, nicely-textured plastic that has a high-quality feel.
sentences.chinese: 高爾夫有漂亮的手縫內飾和良好手感的軟塑料。

definition: acrylic (loanword)/see also 壓克力|压克力[ya1 ke4 li4]
toe box (of a shoe)/shoe last (shoemaker's tool)
paper pattern as model in dressmaking/paper patten
felt-tip pen/roller ball pen/gel ink pen
